Exaggerate: The claim may be exaggerating the requirements for voting in Mexico by stating that every eligible Mexican citizen must have a tamper-proof photo-ID card with a thumbprint and an embossed hologram. It is unclear if these specific requirements apply to all eligible Mexican citizens or if there are alternative methods of identification accepted.
Lack enough support: The claim does not provide sufficient evidence or sources to support the statement about voter ID requirements in Mexico. It only mentions a meme posted by Sid Miller on Facebook and a comment made by him, without providing additional sources or data.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that because voter ID laws seem to be working well in Mexico, they should also work well in Texas. This assumption does not consider the potential differences in the political and social contexts of the two countries.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not consider alternative explanations for the effectiveness of voter ID laws in Mexico. It assumes that voter ID laws are the sole reason for the absence of fraud and abuse in Mexican elections, without considering other factors that may contribute to the integrity of the electoral process.
